intro: Odontadenia hypoglauca, commonly known as the blue-flowered rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Odontadenia hypoglauca is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
